Package com.amazon.ata.debugging.subscribeandsave.service

Class SubscriptionService

java.lang.Object
com.amazon.ata.debugging.subscribeandsave.service.SubscriptionService
public class SubscriptionService
extends java.lang.Object
Subscribe and service API. Currently supports creating subscriptions and fetching them. Subscriptions can only be made for valid amazon products by valid amazon customers. Subscriptions are persisted by the SubscriptionDAO.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    SubscriptionService​(AmazonIdentityService identityService, SubscriptionDAO subscriptionDAO, AmazonProductService productService)
    Creates new subscription service instance with the given dependencies.

  • Constructor Details

    • SubscriptionService

      public SubscriptionService​(AmazonIdentityService identityService, SubscriptionDAO subscriptionDAO, AmazonProductService productService)
      Creates new subscription service instance with the given dependencies.
      Parameters:
      identityService - The identity service to use for validating customers
      subscriptionDAO - The subscription DAO for reading/writing subscriptions
      productService - The product service to use for validating/getting products

  • Method Details

    • subscribe

      public Subscription subscribe​(java.lang.String customerId, java.lang.String asin, int frequency)
      Creates a new subscription for given customer and ASIN for the given frequency (given in months between deliveries).

      Throws IllegalArgumentException if customer ID is blank/invalid, ASIN is blank/invalid, ASIN is unsubscribable, or if frequency is invalid (less than 1 or greater than 6).

      Parameters:
      customerId - The customer's ID
      asin - The ASIN of the product to subscribe customer to
      frequency - The frequency of delivery (delivery every N months)
      Returns:
      the new Subscription if successful, null otherwise

    • getSubscription

      public Subscription getSubscription​(java.lang.String subscriptionId)
      Returns the Subscription corresponding to the given subscription ID.
      Parameters:
      subscriptionId - The ID of the subscription to fetch
      Returns:
      the Subscription if one is found, null otherwise
